intro: Otoglyphis pubescens subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy otoglyphis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical fruits. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
